learning_objective: Model the way programs store and manipulate data by using numbers or other symbols to represent information.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is a budding musician who loves coding. They are trying to write a program to work out the frequency of a musical note in Hertz, based on its placement on a piano. The formula to calculate the frequency of a note is f = 440 * 2^(n/12), where n is the number of keys between the note and A4 (the A key just above middle C). A4 is the 49th key on the piano and its frequency is 440 Hertz. Write a code snippet in Quorum that Alex can use to find out the frequency of the nth key on the piano.",
    "Answer1": "The frequency of the 20th key is approximately 82.41 Hz",
    "Answer2": "The frequency of the 20th key is approximately 123.47 Hz",
    "Answer3": "The frequency of the 20th key is approximately 104.65 Hz",
    "Answer4": "The frequency of the 20th key is approximately 97.99 Hz",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "By substituting the value of the nth key into the formula, we can calculate the frequency of any given key on the piano. For the 20th key, n would be 20-49=-29. Substituting into the formula gives us a frequency of approximately 82.41 Hertz.",
    "code_snippet": "action CalculateFrequency(integer n)\n    integer a4 = 49\n    number frequency = 440 * power(2, (n - a4) / 12)\n    output frequency\nend"
}
